titles.title: United States Semiquincentennial Commission Amendments Act of 2020
United States Semiquincentennial Commission Amendments Act of 2020
United States Semiquincentennial Commission Amendments Act of 2020
United States Semiquincentennial Commission Amendments Act of 2020
United States Semiquincentennial Commission Amendments Act of 2020
United States Semiquincentennial Commission Amendments Act of 2020

A bill to amend the United States Semiquincentennial Commission Act of 2016 to modify certain membership and other requirements of the United States Semiquincentennial Commission, and for other purposes.

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on the Judiciary.
Senate Committee on the Judiciary discharged by Unanimous Consent.

vote.text: Passed Senate without amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Mr. Khanna moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on S. 3989.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Message on House action received in Senate and at desk: House amendment to Senate bill.

vote.text: Senate agreed to the House amendment to S. 3989 by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

bill.summary:
United States Semiquincentennial Commission Amendments Act of 2020
This bill modifies certain requirements of the U.S. Semiquincentennial Commission, which was established to provide for the commemoration of the 250th anniversary of the founding of the United States and related events.
Among other things, the bill
modifies the membership requirements of the commission; changes the date by which the commission shall report to the President with its specific recommendations for the commemoration of the 250th anniversary and related events to March 31, 2020; and grants the commission the exclusive right to use, and to allow others to use, the official marks, imprimaturs, and logos of the commission.
